p: After detecting viral components, transcription factors including NF-κB and IRFs are activated, leading to transcription of IFNs and pro-inflammatory cytokines. IFNs bind to receptors, resulting in upregulation of multiple interferon-stimulated genes (ISGs) [ 145]. It is well known that type I IFNs (IFN-α and IFN-β) and type III IFNs (IFN-λ 1-4) play critical roles in antiviral responses. Mice failed to restrict non-pathogenic IAV when both type I and type III IFN receptors were knocked out [ 146].
